features: Refillable 5-Subject Notebook with Pocket Dividers: Made of durable plastic, our file folder organizer is ideal for students of all grades, homeschoolers, and professionals
Customizable Organization: Our plastic folders with pockets allow you to keep school schedules, syllabi, homework, reference sheets, and more stored front and center for quick and easy access
Convenient Storage: Equally perfect for at-home, virtual, hybrid, or in-person learning, our folders with pockets feature 5 colored erasable dividers and 10 clear view pockets
Valuable Features: File organizer includes 10 clear view pockets for extra storage, a removable 8.5 by 11-inch notepad, and a clipboard cover
Why Samsill: We have been manufacturing quality USA-made home, office, and school supplies in Fort Worth, Texas, since 1953 using domestic and imported materials
body.description: Samsill's 5-subject notebook organizers make ideal home, work, and school supplies. This durable organizer can also be used as a coupon organizer, portfolio folder, receipt organizer, bill organizer, and more. A slanted front cover pocket allows for fast and easy paper storage and includes a removable/refillable notepad. Equipped with 5 different colored tabs, 5 total folders, and 10 pockets, this is the paper storage solution of all solutions — each pocket can comfortably hold 15 to 20 sheets of paper. The possibilities are endless!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for ADHD
reviews.reviewText: My daughter has ADHD. Trying to keep track of school work, notes, and 8 different folders was just a disaster. This thing is great because it essentially keeps all the folders in one place, plus the clipboard part gives a place for whatever is currently being worked on. It’s not as bulky as a trapper keeper, which makes it much easier to carry around in a backpack.It works very well for my kid’s particular brand of ADHD.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best folder organizer for a distracted child or adult.
reviews.reviewText: Stuffed with papers, all classes in one spot in order to take back and forth to school. Folders didn’t tear, or stretch. Easy to organize each folder for every class. But if you have a kid that no matter what, will stuff a paper in any folder this works great because it all goes together.No concern that they left that science work sheet in the social studies folder or that they grabbed the wrong folder because they are together.The entire thing is spiral so it’s easy for a child or an adult to open to the folder they need and not take up an entire desk of space.It’s light weight and as thin as it can be. It’s like switching your closet hangers from thick plastic to thin flocked ones. We first ordered a trapper keeper style folder but it was over sized and heavy without anything in it and those were too big to fit in their backpack.The clipboard and paper is great for quick notes and/or forgotten assignments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Organization to the Max!
reviews.reviewText: This binder is sturdy and has a lot of room for documents and a lined note pad. There isnt another binder like this that I can find so I purchased 2 for home use and 2 fir my office!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Product but Arrived Broken
reviews.reviewText: It is a nice sturdy folder. Bought this last year for my son's high school classes and it was great. So we bought him a new one for this school year and it arrived with one of the tabs broken off. I'm so disappointed.It was in plastic wrap and had bubble wrap in the box, so I don't think the damage happened in transit. Plus, we couldn't find the broken tab piece, so I assume it was gone before being wrapped in plastic. Not going to waste my time to return it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent organization and durability very lite weight

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many uses!
reviews.reviewText: I bought 3, 1 each for my kids and one for me! My son is ADHD so I hope this will help him when he entered 7th Grade in the fall. My daughter and I are already organized and we can’t wait to use this next fall. (I’m a para)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Perfect in helping me organize my clinical paperwork for nursing school clinicals.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Overall a great product
reviews.reviewText: I got this for a child to use for school work. It’s perfect for this. They keep their schedule in the front pocket. Good colors, pockets are easy to use, and the folder swings open easily. The paper pad in the back is study and replaceable. They haven’t tried the erasable tabs yet but I think that is an attractive feature.One caveat is the front clip. This isn’t designed to replaced a heavily used clipboard. It’s study enough for securing papers you don’t replace often, and I don’t worry about it breaking on the teen. However, if you are a power-clipboard person and change papers often, be aware that the front cover flexes. For securing papers such as schedules, it’s great and papers don’t slip.
